channel.title: Was Gordon Freeman's plight for nothing?
channel.description: At the end of opposing Force the Black Mesa Research Facility is destroyed, in Half Life 2 there is Xen fauna everywhere and the Earth is ruled by an evil regime. So was Gordon Freeman's plight in Half Life for nothing?

item.title: Was Gordon Freeman's plight for nothing?
item.dc:creator: eateroftheflame
item.description:
If he hadn’t killed the Nihilanth the rift probably would have stayed open and continued spewing out xen fauna, the nuke in opposing force (confirmed by Marc Laidlaw by the way) probably would have slowed them down but they would have found a way through. Additionally with the Nihilanth alive the vortigaunts would probably still be slaves, though the combine seem to have enslaved a few of them anyway.

Read full topic
item.source: Was Gordon Freeman's plight for nothing?

item.title: Was Gordon Freeman's plight for nothing?
item.dc:creator: SwimSquirrel
item.description:
SwampFox56:

if you remember in half-life 2 alyx says, that mossman always says that it should have been her in the test chamber that day. And eli says, it should have been her in the test chamber that day but you (gordon)beat her because the ADMINISTRATOR (im guessing g-man) picked you because of your phd (or something like that)

The administrator was Doctor Breen… :rolleyes:

EDIT: Sorry Android, I didn’t see you post.

Read full topic
item.source: Was Gordon Freeman's plight for nothing?

item.title: Was Gordon Freeman's plight for nothing?
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
If Gordon hadn’t killed the Nihilanth, most of humanity would probably be dead by the time the Combine arrived.

Read full topic
item.source: Was Gordon Freeman's plight for nothing?

item.title: Was Gordon Freeman's plight for nothing?
item.dc:creator: Android11x
item.description:
SwampFox56:

if you remember in half-life 2 alyx says, that mossman always says that it should have been her in the test chamber that day. And eli says, it should have been her in the test chamber that day but you (gordon)beat her because the ADMINISTRATOR (im guessing g-man) picked you because of your phd (or something like that)

The administrator was Dr. Breen. G-Man didn’t pick you, but he DID pick the Xen crystal sample for any ol’ shmuck in an HEV suit to push in. Lucky us, it’s Gordon Freeman. Oh, and Mossman’s a bitch. I hope she died at that arctic base.

Read full topic

if you remember in half-life 2 alyx says, that mossman always says that it should have been her in the test chamber that day. item.source: Was Gordon Freeman's plight for nothing?

item.title: Was Gordon Freeman's plight for nothing?
item.dc:creator: rorriMAesU
item.description:
bobandquizo:

He was probably the one who made Gordon do the experiment

Nothing implies that the G-man made Gordon do anything or knew of his “potential” before the RC. I think the G-man provided the sample to cause the RC, but did not expect Gordon’s survival behind the scenes. Gordon unexpectedly impressed the G-man and perhaps that is what saved Gordon’s life.

I could be wrong, I am not fluent with the entire HL chronicle.

Read full topic
item.source: Was Gordon Freeman's plight for nothing?

item.title: Was Gordon Freeman's plight for nothing?
item.dc:creator: Pettifogg
item.description:
This thread assumes Gordon’s plight ends at the beginning of Half-Life 2. Can’t it all be part of the same plight?

item.source: Was Gordon Freeman's plight for nothing?

item.title: Was Gordon Freeman's plight for nothing?
item.dc:creator: rorriMAesU
item.description:
bobandquizo:

…So was Gordon Freeman’s plight in Half Life for nothing?

I think it was due to Gordon’s plight that the G-man took ultimate interest in him. Gordon’s adventure through Black Mesa saved his life, but thanks to the G-man.

My question is, did the G-man have interest in Gordon before the RC ever took place? Was he aware of Gordon’s potential from the very start and set him up?

Read full topic

item.source: Was Gordon Freeman's plight for nothing?

item.title: Was Gordon Freeman's plight for nothing?
item.dc:creator: Chevelle19V
item.description:
No. His goal wasn’t to prevent the Earth from being overrun by aliens or to save the facility, he was just trying to escape and survive. Obviously he was successful, so it wasn’t for nothing.

Read full topic
item.source: Was Gordon Freeman's plight for nothing?

item.title: Was Gordon Freeman's plight for nothing?
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
The second episode in a trilogy always ends on a down note in order to raise the stakes in the final conflict for the last episode.
